works.description: Mexican tycoon and art lover Carlos Slim Helu, who topped the Forbes Billionaires List 2011 for the second year in a row with a fortune of $74 billion., has now given his home city Mexico City a new art museum – the Soumaya Museum. Named after his late wife, the Soumaya Museum is now open to the public, and will house around 60,000 works of art by renowned artists like Rodin, Leonardo da Vinci and other European artists, as well as those by Mexican muralists Diego Rivera and David Alfaro Siqueiros.
